#Conditional statements with if-else
```{r}
## Generate a uniform random number
x <- runif(1, 0, 10)  
if(x > 3) {
        y <- 10
} else {
        y <- 0
}
```

# For Loops
```{r}
for(i in 1:8) {
        print(i)
}
```
```{r}
x <- c("I", "like", "cheese", "pizza")
for(i in 1:4) {
        ## Print out each element of 'x'
        print(x[i])  
}
```

```{r}
## Generate a sequence based on length of 'x'
for(i in seq_along(x)) {   
        print(x[i])
}
```

```{r}
for(letter in x) {
        print(letter)
}
```
```{r}
for(i in 1:4) print(x[i])
```

# Nested for loops
```{r}
x <- matrix(1:4, 2, 3)
for(i in seq_len(nrow(x))) {
        for(j in seq_len(ncol(x))) {
                print(x[i, j])
        }   
}
```
# While Loops
```{r}
count <- 0
while(count < 9) {
        print(count)
        count <- count + 1
}
```

```{r}
#Example: Flipping a coin
z <- 5
set.seed(1)
while(z >= 3 && z <= 10) {
        coin <- rbinom(1, 1, 0.5)
        
        if(coin == 1) {  ## random walk
                z <- z + 1
        } else {
                z <- z - 1
        } 
}
print(z)
```

```{r}
f <- function(num) {
        for(i in seq_len(num)) {
                cat("I like this lab so far!\n")
        }
}
f(2)
```

```{r}
f <- function(num) {
        hello <- "I ate icecream for breakfast today :/\n"
        for(i in seq_len(num)) {
                cat(hello)
        }
        chars <- nchar(hello) * num
        chars
}
meaningoflife <- f(2)
```

```{r}
print(meaningoflife)
```

```{r}
f <- function(num = 1) {
        hello <- "I'm graduating!\n"
        for(i in seq_len(num)) {
                cat(hello)
        }
        chars <- nchar(hello) * num
        chars
}
f()    ## Use default value for 'num'
```

```{r}
f(3)   ## Use user-specified value
```

```{r}
f(num = 2)
```
